description: Apparently imitative, probably under influence of break + rattle.

verbs.description: brattle (third-person singular simple present brattles, present participle brattling, simple past and past participle brattled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To rattle; to make a scampering noise.
examples: Him too I hate, the same as I hate these brainless budding trees, these brattling birds.
